Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a drab-coloured pottery vessel, the fabric contains a number of small white inclusions, the interior bears traces of a trail of green-coloured deposit, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text.
Curator's comments: Pendlebury, City of Akhenaten 3, plate XCV n. 284
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394022) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394022)
